metadata.review_summary:
Taberna dos Fernandes is popular among many travelers for its warm and family-oriented atmosphere, with unique decor enhancing its quaint ambiance. While some travelers highlight long wait times due to the no-reservation policy, most agree the authentic and flavorful food, especially the seafood dishes like octopus and seafood rice, makes it worthwhile.

The friendly and attentive service also earns praise, contributing to the overall value, which travelers often find reasonable despite the wait for seating.
metadata.address: Rua da Fonte Taurina 70, Porto 4050-553 Portugal

reviews.review_text: Seafood rice and octopus salad were phenomenal!! Amazing service as well. Went for lunch and lined up right before opening to get a table. Highly recommend!

We had no idea that the restaurant we were about to have a long, boozy lunch in was a Michelin star level establishment disguised as a typical taberna. The restaurant is in the heart of the Ribera district/tourist area, so our expectations were set accordingly, and incorrectly. The atmosphere is very unique, with a beautifully lit ceiling that resembles the hull of an inverted boat. My husband and I split fried sardines and an octopus salad to start. The sardines were deliciously delicate and the octopus almost melted in your mouth. The octopus was immersed in a finely diced, pico de gallo-like sauce that was bright and refreshing. For the mains, my husband had the prawns and I had the fish of the day, a grilled sea bream. The server was a true artisan who filleted my fish impeccably. The fish was served with potatoes and saut√©ed vegetables that were seasoned to perfection. The fish was moist, delicate, and so wonderfully flavored with what I can only imagine was lemon, garlic, olive oil and salt. We were blown away. The prawns were the best we‚Äôd had in Portugal. It was our last day in Porto, but had we been here on our first day, we would have come back again and again. The lovely family that runs all aspects of the restaurant (chef and servers) are experts in their craft of hospitality and cooking. We are extremely grateful and lucky to have found this gem.

The best restaurant in Porto, there is always a queue to access the restaurant (there are only seats so you have to arrive around 18h20 for service of 7pm). Attentive service and in French. The octopus is fantastic and very tender. Everything is home cooked and perfectly seasoned.

A small, friendly place, we‚Äôve visited for a few years now, and always look forward to returning. However, our favourite dish, the octopus rice, was no longer on the menu. 

We had the roast octopus and fish of the day, which were decent, but not the best we‚Äôve had in Porto. But the octopus rice was exceptional, please bring it back.
Excellent place for lunch, very nice atmosphere and food full of taste, staff of the best with great care and super attentive üëç

We were recommended this family run restaurant by a friend. It sits in spa street just behind the riverbank. You cannot book and we had to queue for 45 minutes to get a table. It opens at 7pm and people start queuing at 6pm.

It is worth the wait.

From the friendly family, mother and son front of house and husband in the kitchen. They made everyone feel welcome and all the food was cooked fresh.

We were almost the last customers to leave the restaurant and were just chatting, they didn‚Äôt rush us and even recommended other restaurants to try in the local area.
The food is very good and full. The waiter was very friendly, cost X benefit was good too. Indicate pq the locations also frequent.

We ate the rice pan with seafood, it tasted great and you definitely get full:) The service was excellent, very friendly and funny:) You have to queue and cannot reserve, so it is recommended to queue before the opening time at 19:00. It is definitely worth it!

Our first evening in Porto, guided by Trip Advisor, we arrived at the restaurant at 7:45 pm and it was full. There are no reservations taken in advance. You need to be in he queue at 6:45 or wait for the later sitting. It only takes 22 guests. We went back another evening at 6:15pm and the queue was already forming. The queue was organised and supervised by the staff. Opened at 7pm and what a delight. Family run by father (the chef) with mother, Regina, and son, Hugo serving. A great family atmosphere.
We had fried sardines and Bolinho de Bacalao as starters which were delicious. I had polvo (Octopus) a lagareiro. My wife had Bacalao (Cod) a lagareiro. Excellent Portuguese fare. All very fresh. 
Fantastic and well worth the wait.  A special treat in this wonderful city. A great choice.  Good value.
Excellent food, environment and service. The outdoors are spectacular! Imperishable. You have to come early, but it's worth waiting.

Really amazing family owned and operated restaurant. We had great fresh traditional Portuguese meal. Father was in the back cooking, we were served by the matriarch‚Äî Regina who was an absolute joy, and their sweet son‚Äî Hugo!! The restaurant is very small, but absolutely worth the wait. Get there early to get in line. Would absolutely visit again!!

Great.
Ada food and surroundings, Porto is always magical thanks to its corners and taverns, there are still charming places

We had lunch in this typical restaurant during our visit to Porto. What about, experience that I recommend to everyone. The place is small but cozy, located in a parallel to the river bank. Since the place doesn't have many seats, the advice is to arrive at least an hour before the opening to get in line, or wait patiently for Hugo to make you sit down. The wait is ABSOLUTELY worth it. The dishes are sublimely cooked and are all delicious, but the real difference is the staff. Hugo and Regina bring their kindness into everything and make everything like being with the family! One of the best things to do in Porto, absolutely.

Thanks for a fantastic food experience. After walking the Camino we ended with a few days in Porto. Last night we ate here. A family-run restaurant with a fantastic atmosphere, food and atmosphere.
We ate bacalao, best we have tasted and got a lovely surprise dessert at last.
Be out in good time, no table reservation, but it's worth it in line to experience Taberna dos Fernandes. Thank you, greetings from Aud and Toril

We came for the first time, in light of the restaurant's rankings. The turn was big, and we gave up. We came back two days later, and we stood in the line half an hour before the turn at 9:00. 

The menu is similar or identical to that of all the local taverns.

The quality of the food was good but did not exceed that of other restaurants where we ate in Porto.

Prices are about 10% higher than other restaurants of local character.

Okay, but not as she shouted.
 - The exchange is not worth the long waiting line and probably not the definition of "one of the best restaurants in Porto"

There were no locals among them!

In conclusion, one of many without any culinary outline.

metadata.meal_types: Lunch, Dinner, Brunch, Late Night, Drinks

metadata.address: R. do Passeio Alegre 350, Porto 4150-572 Portugal

reviews.review_text: What a fabulous meal to celebrate an anniversary ‚Ä¶ great service our waiters were knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive.. the food was outstanding we had delicious mussels to start and the most amazing seafood paella. The restaurant is spacious and light with high ceilings. Would highly recommend.

Great service, our glasses were never empty:)! We were a. Party of 8 and sat upstairs on a round table. The decor is lovely. I decided to have a paella of shellfish as it came recommended, normally I am not a fan of paella, but this was superb, delicious with wonderful caramelised rice at the bottom of the pan. The best I‚Äôve ever tasted. Highly recommend

In the middle of a small row of cafes just a hop skip and a jump from the Douro (after lunch take a stroll along the promenade), this pleasant cafe / wine bar is located right next to a tram stop. 

Indoor or outdoor seating, offering a tempting menu of options suitable for all palates. 

I had the frittata - admittedly more a starter - which was absolutely gorgeous but on the small side. I did expect something a little bigger. The choice of dips with the fresh bread were tasty and fresh. 

Price is mid range

Far from being a paella‚Ä¶ more like rice cooked in a wood-fired oven with seafood on top.
It belongs to restaurants that force ‚Äútipping‚Äù at the time of payment, calling it gratuity and that's why I won't go back. I, like some people I know, boycott restaurants that practice this inelegance that they think are in the United States where the service is not included.

This stylish restaurant has a lovely lunch menu with lots of light inexpensive options. My husband had the Parma focaccia which he enjoyed and I had the salmon quinoa and avocado salad which was disappointing. I was told that the avocado was in the dressing, as it was not otherwise present . The dressing was very salty and had a lot of lemon juice which overpowered everything else , including the very nice looking cured salmon. 
It was also a shame that we were not allowed to have the window open as it was a beautiful warm day. The service was very good.

Very insufficient doses not justifying the price. The rice from the paellas was raw. The employee's justification was that it was not raw but rather too long in the oven. I did not agree, because the rice had no taste,I just knew raw rice.
The dish of the robalo was well cooked, however a portion too small but with a lot of pur√©.
The white wine sangria was very good.

I don‚Äôt know where to start. I had their paella during the summer and it was fantastic. That fantastic that I wanted to go back. This time, it was impossible to eat the meat. I kindly asked them to put the meat in a separate box. They didn‚Äôt even ask if it was ok. I told them that I will give it to the cats. When I gave this feedback, th√© answer was ‚Äúsorry, no one complained before, that‚Äôs weird‚Äù. No one is not my reference, my previous experience is my reference. Some restaurants unfortunately don‚Äôt know how to handle   a feedback or how to treat their customers. And trust me I am not a fussy, grumpy person. Avoid this place!

Went for lunch on a local friend recommendation and glad we went. Really liked the concept of preparing most of the dishes in a wood fire oven. Good appetizers and mains. They are good with the veggies, seafood and meat as well. Professional service. Worth a visit.

The food was OUTSTANDING. The Salm√£o asi√°tico and the entrec√¥te with Pur√© trufado was the nicest thing I have ever tasted. The Service was fast and effective. It‚Äôs well worth the money. We had Burrata, Salm√£o asi√°tico, Tempura, La Frittata, carpaccio de picanha as starter‚Ä¶ and Entrec√¥te with Pure trufado,  arroz de Porto, arroz de marisco. Every meal looked 10/10 and evidently tasted 10/10. I highly recommend Habitat Terra e Fogo.

Great food for dinner and quick lunch.
Be aware, for lunch the have only starters and focaccias, but they are great!
Focaccia with steak is top!

For dinner you can check full menu, everything with seafood is great, also marvelous beef Wellington!

We had dinner last night here, a nice restaurant in Borto, a pleasant atmosphere, the menu is limited.
In general, good food and excellent service, we had a tempura with a twist, seafood paella (similar to Spanish), and salad.
I would rate this restaurant good overall.
Price mid-Hi 
Recommended

Very pretty restaurant, friendly and pleasant service. Refined dishes, beautiful presentation. Very good Douro wine.
We had a paella for 2: very good fish. Downside on the rice which would have needed more cooking but otherwise very good. Price a little high. Homemade and fresh dishes. Super good desserts. To test !!
Great sharing concept menu with really fresh, delicious and interesting dishes. The fire cabbage is amazing. Lovely location, friendly service and good prices. Definitely worth a visit.

The food and service were decent, nothing extraordinary but good enough for a pleasant meal. Prices are acceptable for what‚Äôs offered. What really makes this place stand out is the stunning view over the Douro ‚Äì absolutely worth it just for that. A great spot to relax and take in the scenery, and walk after the meal!

I like this restaurant, it has beautiful decor and is in a privileged location.
The food is pleasant and the service is friendly.
However, nothing is more unpleasant than having dinner with a cold wind running down your back every time a front door opens. And it opened many times... I think the customer's comfort is essential for a good meal.
I will be back in the summer.

metadata.review_summary:
Cantinho Do Avillez Porto offers generally flavorful dishes, with octopus and risotto being standout options, though some travelers find certain meals bland or overpriced. Wait times can be unpredictable, prompting many to recommend making reservations. Service receives mixed reviews; some describe it as attentive and friendly, while others find it slow.

The vibrant atmosphere, complemented by excellent decor and music, is appreciated by many, though some suggest improvements. Opinions on value are divided, with some seeing it as reasonable and others as overpriced.
metadata.address: Rua Mouzinho Da Silveira, 166, Porto 4050-416 Portugal

reviews.review_text:
Arrived a bit early for our reservation and sat outside to enjoy an aperitif.  Once seated all of the dishes were presented with great care and were delicious.

Service was excellent and attentive.

We ate well - shrimp and croquetes to start.  An adaptation of a Francesinha and a seafood stew (Moqueca de corvina) for mains.  Coffee and a shared chocolate desert.

Tab for two (along with cocktails and a glass of wine) was about 120 euro or 130 including the suggested tip.

A most enjoyable meal - but not for those on a budget.,

The price is not cheap, but the waitresses' attention is very nice and the food was very good. We ordered octopus tart and cod nuggets and then a couple of risottos that were ten. Beers, a dessert to share and a coffee for 50‚Ç¨ / person

I have to give this place the highest rating possible. On our last night of family vacation in Portugal and Spain, we ended up browsing the streets of Porto, in hope to find a nice restaurant for dinner. Walking by Cantinho do Avillez we noticed a Michelin plaque, were very impressed with the quality of menu, but reasonable pricing for a Michelin restaurant, so we decided to eat here. Little did we know, that we needed reservations to get in! Fortunately, after we inquired within, manager on duty, Vitor, told us that we could have a table outside, on a sidewalk, which we wanted anyway. As soon as we sat down and ordered drinks it started raining, heavier and heavier. We asked if there‚Äôs any chance we could eat inside, but there was no room! However we hung around at the entrance to finish our drinks and kept talking to Vitor, hoping for an opening. Vitor performed some miracle and was able to seat us at one of the inside tables, but we had only 45 min to eat, because the table was reserved for later. We happily jumped on an opportunity, and what a feast we had! Quality of the food was absolutely out of this world. We had bread with spreads, deep fried beans, oven roasted cheese for an appetizer and then curry duck, Brazilian fish, scallops and stake dishes. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. Vitor stopped by to check on us. As we were exceeding our time to leave by little, Vitor assured us that we had time for desert, but we asked for the check earlier and waiter already gave it to us. Vitor insisted and arranged for a complimentary desert for the kids anyway, as we already paid the bill. Like I said, this was our final dinner of our 2 week trip, and believe you me! We ate some great stuff over our vacation, including at another Michelin restaurant. But Vitor truly made our night and vacation. This was a perfect ending to a perfect vacation. Muito obrigado, Vitor!

The good bits.... food was very tasty. We shared octopus tartare , and had sirloin steak and duck leg curry for mains, then creme brulee.
The bad bits... service was slow and dull. One waitress asked if we wanted a dessert.... when we hadn't even had the mains. The background music was like nite club music.... a bit of light jazz would be better. The lighting was quite dim... the family beside us used torches on their phone to see the menu and shined light into our 
faces. The steak was served in a dark bowl which was difficult to cut steak in... we asked for a flat white plate. The creme brulee was not hard on top... we asked that be hardened a bit and it came back burnt on top. When the bill came it was almost ‚Ç¨10 more than expected (‚Ç¨137).....they had added a suggested tip which I declined to give preferring to leave a chosen cash tip, however after a final visit to the toilet which had no toilet paper we decided there was too much wrong to leave a tip at all. Hence the reason for a 3* review... I would have preferred a 5* experience.

We arrived without reservation, the restaurant just had a few take tables, it felt like it had messed them up they didn't know if it was possible... we had to wait...
The menu is rich enough as the price of the dishes.
No menus, only √† la carte.
No √† la carte children's dishes, but you have to ask for it at the time of ordering (phew otherwise it's a 17‚Ç¨ dish üòì).
As for the dishes, the prices are not justified. 27‚Ç¨ the small octopus tentacle (spongeful and waterlogged) placed on a mashed potato.
Invoice 150‚Ç¨ for 3 adults and one child (dish + drink).

The entire gastronomic experience, as far as the food is concerned, lived up to expectations, congratulations to the chef and cooks! The croquettes are great, the duck confit was perfect and the hazelnut dessert was the "cherry"! The same cannot be said about room service. Weak, inattentive, slow and with little care when communicating. We chose to be understandable up to a certain point BUT wait 10 minutes to see the Letter, while watching a very happy waitress dancing (and congratulations on the good mood but I mean... ) however in the end still receiving passive-aggressive responses at the moment that WITHOUT WARNING they "charge" another ‚Ç¨8 to the account as a bonus made everything more ridiculous... to the girl with short hair in the room, know that despite the language barrier, the Portuguese know how to identify when they are actually well treated and when they are not stupid You usually go back to places where you feel good and that's worth more than ‚Ç¨8. There were some very ridiculous moments that ruin all the effort and sacrifice of the rest of the team.

We went to the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary of dating but I felt that dinner was at 6, the tables are so together from each other that I, being pregnant, could not pass to the side of the couch, otherwise I would lay the drinks on the floor of the people who were next to us, without exaggerating. When we asked about the ingredients of the dishes the staff did not know how to answer and the sympathy was not too much. We went through the experience and came disappointed. The dishes also they were not surprised except the calf risotto that was nice. We paid 100‚Ç¨ for a medium dinner, in a space with no privacy and poor service. I do not recommend.

We saw this in the Michelin guide and as it seemed to offer the contemporary take on Portuguese food we were looking for we made a reservation. The website is in four languages (Portuguese, English, Spanish and French), as befits an outpost of a chef apparently well known in Portugal.
I had the prawns in olive oil and white wine with garlic, lemon and coriander, which was tasty but not particularly standout, followed by the confit of cod on Mafra bread and beautifully cooked savoy cabbage, with poached egg that transformed the cod once broken into, the egg yolk and cod being something sublime. My partner very much enjoyed her checking salad.
My dessert, a take on toucinho-do-ceu served with a delicious raspberry sorbet was unhelpfully served in a glass jar (for the couple beside us that turned what had been meant as a sharing experience into rather satisfactory shuttle service but staff failed to warn of that presentation), which made it more awkward to eat, a little undersized and not really adding anything aesthetically. My partner had sliced seasonal fresh fruit - if a restaurant is going to charge for this it really should be good quality but in her view was disappointing and outshone by that served at our hotel breakfast buffet. 
Service was prompt and helpful and there was a good, lively atmosphere in the restaurant. 
Overall an enjoyable evening but let down by lack of attention on desserts.

New Year‚Äôs Eve we went with reservations and high expectations after eating in some amazing spots in Lisbon and Porto this restaurant was highly recommended by previous guests. We all came out dissatisfied at the terrible service starting with a bipolar host at the entrance, waiters that barely took care of us and dishes that I can prepare myself at home with much more grace and flavor. Michelin might need to review their ratings and some biases. This restaurant has the ambience of a trattoria with mediocre food. Do not recommend it for the high price tag there are much better and nicer places in Porto.

Visiting Porto, after a few days of enjoying its wonderful gastronomy and friendly people, before finishing our trip we wanted to close the trip with a golden clasp by dining in this restaurant, excited and eager to discover it. It was a real disappointment, from start to finish. I can only say that the service has been completely nefarious, not a smile or a question, not a suggestion .. when you make the reservation you are asked language preference and do not have even the letter in the language (Spanish), commenting that we did not decide yet as we had to translate many of the ingredients was totally indifferent to them .. zero kindness. The food without more, the insipid starters, as a main course the veal risotto was rich. We will certainly not return, let alone recommend it. Too bad.

I was so disappointed with the service that I received for my lunch today. I booked a table at 3pm with my wife as we were recommended the restaurant by a friend. The specifically recommended the set lunch menu for ‚Ç¨18.50. The reason we booked the last lunch slot at 3pm was due to us returning to Lisbon that evening and wanted a late lunch. When we arrived we were handed the a la carte menu, we asked the waiter for the set lunch menu only to be told that you couldn‚Äôt order from that menu after 1:30pm. We reluctantly ordered off of the a la carte menu. When we went to pay there was a service charge added to the bill. We asked for that to be removed due to our displeasure. The waitress then said that you can order from the lunch menu up until 3pm (we arrived and sat down for our table at 2:55pm). After the meal I looked at the website and could not find the information about timings for the lunch menu anywhere. If you cannot order the lunch menu after 3pm then either the restaurant should not accept bookings at 3pm or the timings for the lunch menu should be advertised somewhere.

We enjoyed every restaurant we dined at in Porto...except this one. It was noisy and crowded, but in spite of the crowd, it was cold. The chairs were rickety and uncomfortable. The food was bland and the portions were very small. Due to a fish allergy, there were no main courses that I could eat, but when I asked the server if I should order three or four appetizers, she said three. Well, I walked away hungry. This restaurant definitely does not live up to the "hype."

Really tough to be a single here. Food and service really underwhelming based on hype. Sitting at bar usually gets you better service. Watched host turn multiple people away and dining room was half empty. Maybe off night ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

For the New Year's Eve, to be celebrated at home, and being a vegetarian, I ordered dinner from this restaurant delivered by uber eats. As a vegetarian option I could only order a green caril. I also ordered a niza cheese with tomato chutney. I had great expectations and I convinced myself that I would eat well. Disappointment. The caril, which looked more like a soup, had no taste and the ingredients left to be desired. The cheese had no interest either. So, and after paying expensive, I got no dinner. Sorry. I was expecting much better.

Best meal I had in Porto during my stay. We made a reservation (it is essential!) and the house was full, unlike the other restaurants that were empty because it was not yet high season. But from the entrance to the restaurant door to the exit the service was IMPECABLE. With a lot of cordiality and sympathy, the waiters did not leave to wish in absolutely nothing. The food was delicious and surprised me by the complexity and specialty of the flavors. The portions are not large and I found, in my plate, little dust for a lot of potato pur√©. But that didn't affect the experience. The dish was very tasty and was the best pulp I ate in the whole trip through Portugal. The desserts were also great, I highly recommend the raspberries, it's an explosion of flavors in the mouth. My only reservation is about the space a little tight and with tables very close to each other, but that was not a problem. I highly recommend the meal in this place!

metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

reviews.review_text:
This restaurant is exactly what I expect when I see a Michelin rating. I honestly am starting to prefer it more than Michelin star restaurants. 

Right in the beginning the entree was a statement, while the bread was not life changing, I found the olive Oil they offered to be of incredible quality, three varieties of butters that were incredibly tasty. 

When it was time to order, they instantly had me impressed by the fact that their relatively complex menu had not a single dish over 30‚Ç¨. 

We were three people, we ordered the Cod, the Beef Wellington and the Pepper Steak. 
For a starter we shared a beef carpaccio. 

The beef carpaccio came in amazing, it was incredibly fresh with an amazing texture, great seasoning and oh god that special mayonnaise was amazing. 

When it was time for mains, all dishes arrived at the same time. All had an amazing visual. The cod was one of the best I‚Äôve eaten in Portugal, and I have tried a lot‚Ä¶ incredibly tender and delicious, accompanied by and amazing potato cheese egg trio that fit perfectly. 
The beef wellington was a bit of an experimental recipe, so not to be compared with the traditional one. However it impressed, flaky and crunchy but yet so tender. And the pepper steak was a classic. 
It was just as I expected it, perfectly cooked and seared, with that perfect taste. 

For the star of the show, we shared three desserts, the crepe flamb√©ed, the fruit platter and the house classic chocolate cake. 

Oh, my, word. The fruit was not anything special, but good. The crepes on the other hand were, creamy, flaky and delicious. 
What really nailed it however was the cake. That soft cake with a salty chocolate topping together with the homemade ice cream was one of the best things I‚Äôve had in my life. 

Portion sizes were perfec, and the service spectacular. And with wine, we paid 180‚Ç¨ for 3 persons. 

I can only recommend this restaurant.

Cafe√≠na is a truly outstanding restaurant, exuding class and sophistication from the moment you step in. The ambiance is effortlessly elegant, creating the perfect setting for a refined dining experience.

The food is exceptional from start to finish, with each dish crafted to perfection. Service is attentive and professional, complemented by good tableware. Best of all, the prices are fair for the quality offered, making the experience even more enjoyable.

Every visit to Cafe√≠na is a pleasure, making it a go-to spot for a consistently excellent meal. A must-visit for those who appreciate fine dining in style!

Definitely Michelin recommended- we were asked if we wanted bread as a cover- amazing goats butter, intense flavour from the pate.
We skipped starters as it was a very late lunch service and felt like private dining- lovely polite & friendly staff.
I really enjoyed the large fillet of sea bass- so juicy- which was served with effectively a rice seaweed risotto- felt like I was walking on the beach!
Exceptional pudding served with scrumptious Port- would easily choose everything from the menu. Fantastic and very creamy Gorgonzola ice- cream with a hint of salt.

Hello, we just ate at Cafeina restaurant and I wanted to share my thoughts with you. We are a couple
We have just arrived, we sit down and the waitress brings us 4 pieces of bread, 5 or 6 olives and a piece of goat's cheese and a piece of normal butter.
We understood the day before while eating in another restaurant in Porto that this type of service was chargeable and without asking us anything. So we tell the waitress that we don't want it. She tells us that the bread is very warm with a sad look. We therefore accept the bread and butter so as not to upset her or disappoint her, knowing very well that it will cost us ‚Ç¨7.
Afterwards, she offers us a bottle of water. We decline his offer and instead ask him for 2 glasses of white wine (15 cl as indicated on the menu).
She comes back 5 minutes later, uncorking a bottle of water in front of us. We tell him again that we don't want water. So, she grabs the bottle of white wine and serves us two glasses with very small portions.
I tell my wife that it looks more like 5 cl portions instead of 15 cl as indicated on the menu. I don't say anything to the waitress so as not to start arguments and upset my wife. Subsequently, 3 people arrive at the next table. They order 1 glass of red wine and confirms what I thought. Their glass was more than twice as full as our glasses. Luckily for us we accepted the bread, butter and 6 olives for ‚Ç¨7. We decide not to have dessert to leave as quickly as possible. Indeed, we are very disappointed and we find all this unfair. As I told my wife, I check the bill being firmly convinced that the waitress will want to count the water for us. Alas, I was right to be wary. She actually counted the water in the bill. I tell the waitress that we haven't consumed any water and I ask her to do it again. She accepts.
On the other hand, on the receipt for the bill, they offer to leave a tip of 5% and then again, on the credit card machine, they offer to leave a tip of your choice of 5%, 10% or 15 %. Haha

This was our third visit.
We were disappointed overall.

We waited for the aperitif served to us, despite two reminders from us, at the same time as the starter.

The quality of the food was well present, the Wellington beef was well cooked and very good.

On the other hand, 220 euros to four, without bottle of wine is completely excessive! 

To summarize, service not up to standard, quality of dishes ok but addition too expensive.

Too bad because we liked this address.

I stumbled on Cafe√≠na by walking by. I was intrigued and the reviews were mostly great. We had a reservation for 7:30 (19h30) and were told they needed the table back by 9:30 (21h30). Not a problem. The atmosphere is quite nice so we were excited. Unfortunately, the food was not great.

We ordered the fish soup, beef Wellington and the tiger prawns. Before we had taken a bite of food, except for the bread, two managers came by to ask if everything was ok.  At that point, it was.

But it wasn‚Äôt when we took a few bites. Both the soup and the beef had undercooked puff pastry. The beef Wellington is described on the menu as "Beef Fillet, Mushrooms Duxelle, Foie Gras in Puff Pastry with Roasted Vegetables" That was not what we got. We got inconsistently cooked pieces of meat wrapped in undercooked puff pastry. The mushroom duxelles and foie gras were nowhere to be found. And while one small roasted onion cut in half and two tiny bok choy leaves technically constitutes a serving of roasted vegetables, it‚Äôs not really a serving. Two of the beef Wellingtons were bloody red in the middle and the other was well done.  The person who go the tiger prawns was very happy with their meal.

As they got busy, service slowed. After being told we had to vacate the table at 9:30-9:45, We weren‚Äôt able to flag down our waiter for the bill until after 10:00p (22h00) so I don‚Äôt understand why they told us we needed to leave. It just added anxiety to the evening. 

To be fair, we didn‚Äôt complain and did not give them the opportunity for fix things.

Had the scallops and carpaccio for starters. Scallops were delectable however i think it is reasonable to expect an even number. Carpaccio was a big portion, however it could have done with more pickle onion or greens and was lacking parmesan. The server suggested Douro white wine, which was fantastic and light. The service was quick and attentive. My mustard steak was one of the best iv ever had. Melts in your mouth, with a succulent gratin. The tiger prawn was alright. The chocolate cake, was more like a ganache. Again, for a restaurant of this caliber and formal setting I would opt for something easier to eat than stick to the teeth. Reservations r preferred in this joint. It is 6 mins from Praia da luz, which is nice to see the sunset and have a drink before dinner at Cafeina. Total bill for 2 incldg bottle of wine and tip was ‚Ç¨144.

First visit to Porto and a great start to our lovely trip. We were 5 people (staying at the Vila Foz for a special birthday celebration). The restaurant is beautiful with its decor and soft lighting. We all had a great meal though the first course was very slow in coming out to be served. The waiter explained that the chef wasn‚Äôt happy with the lobster soup which was fine as always pleased when the staff come out to explain any delays and it was absolutely delicious when it did eventually come out. We are a very foodie family and the restaurant was such a great start to our holiday.

Honestly, the place is quite nice. But the service quality isn‚Äôt... And what‚Äôs with that hard, thin, and expensive couvert? ‚Ç¨7 per couple for three thin slices of bread and two small hard ‚Äúrocks‚Äù? üòµ‚Äçüí´

We came here last week for dinner on a week day night. The service was amazing. I would recommend everyone trust their recommendation of dishes. We had tiger prawn linguini and it was one of my favorite in Porto. Everything about this dish was perfect and they served it into plates because my partner and me were sharing our entrees. Beef Wellington was great as well (yes, they served it with separate plates).

Cafeina is our favourite restaurant in Porto. I'm sure I've reviewed it before. But we had not been for a while. Realising that omission we went for lunch. And it was such a good experience that we made plans to make it a monthly treat. The plan lasted only two weeks and we were back again. The quality of the food is excellent. Special mention for the Carpaccio de Maronesa DOP, Portugal's best kept secret beats Wagyu hands-down. The staff are brilliant, Enrico and Joel deserve special mention. Both lunches were five stars and we may have find some willpower to keep our visits to only twice a month!

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and contemporary feel. It offers high quality food on the basis of nicely presented dishes  The wine selection was impressive and  the staff is attentive and friendly. Absolutely recommendable !

Another great experience. From food, to service, to welcoming/accompanying. (Monica and Camila). Duck Maigret, Wellington Bife and Pepper Bife are the preparation for divine desserts where difficulty is the choice! Thank you for the experience and usual sympathy and professionalism in the welcoming and service that, more and more, make all the difference and make us feel at home.

We have been in Portugal for 2 weeks and this was our best meal by far. Our server, Wesley was perfect in every recommendation from the wine to the starter to the main course.  He made us feel like he was welcoming us into his own home.  The Maitre D‚Äô was equally pleasant and accommodating.  We had 2 appetizers, salmon and scallops and they were outstanding.   My beef tenderloin with mustard sauce was so tender and delicious.  It is a 25 minute Uber drive from the city center but we‚Äôll worth the drive to this upscale Porto neighborhood.   If you want to eat with more of a local crowd and receive outstanding service and food this is your place.

restaurant_name: 9. Casa Aberta Open Bar & Food House

metadata.restaurant_name: Casa Aberta Open Bar & Food House
metadata.address: Rua Padre Luis Cabral 1080, Porto 4150-461 Portugal

metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

reviews.review_text:
We have dinner on a Saturday with reservation for four in this Italian restaurant based on starters and pizzas.
The starters are very good and the pizzas are also very good made on the go and very quality.
The service, we received Bottle, excellent, without more. A person who likes his job.

We have eaten there every time we stay in the region for 3 years.
The location is ideal (viewed on the bridge and the river) the tasting menu is really nice, as is the service. (Thank you again for offering and moving our table inside after a little downpour).
See you next year

Very welcoming and friendly service. The food is super delicious, sushi and specialties on the house. We had sushi, very tasty and specialty salmon with miso, green beans fried and dumplings are homemade. Pair with a delicious wine.  Location is historic center, side road from it. We recommend this restaurant.

I was offered three menus at this place, Portuguese, Sushi, Italian. We chose the Italian menu and the service was slow and horrible. It took them 40 minutes for two slides of bread with cheese and then we waited for almost an hour for the main course while three other customers that came after us were serve the main course. The waiter said that probably someone was tasting our patient, which was not funny at all. My partner complained to one of the servers and she offered a dessert as compensation for the bad service and to my surprise she included it in the bill, obviously I complained and she said to the other server that she didn‚Äôt offered the dessert as compensation for the bad service so I ask to speak with the manager and all of the sudden she took it off the bill. This was the only place where I experienced bad service and by the way we were the only black and Latino seated in the restaurant. I spent 12 days in Portugal and all the other restaurants were nice except from this one. Stay away from this restaurant especially if you are black), the servers were unprofessional and horrible and the food was mediocre.

A tourist catch. For 18 euros a focaccia is only several sandwiches: bread and salmon almost no fillings as noted on the menu, let's not look for cheese yet. 
And all served cold
43 euros for 2 foccaccias and 2 small waters
The view of Douro is expensive!!

A scam, a huge scam:
Nobody in the restaurant even though Porto is full of tourists, so you shouldn't be surprised:
A disastrous menu with everything from steak to pizza to sushi...
18‚Ç¨ for 6 small sushi, not even good!
We asked the people in charge for explanations, but got no reply, just disrespectful people.
If you want to eat to your heart's content without risking illness or losing ‚Ç¨80 (for 3 people), don't choose Cais 35.
Continue your search for restaurants and enjoy your stay in Porto.

My daughter chose here as it's served ltalian and Japanese food in the same restaurant.i chose gyzo and sushi üç£ bit tastless and gyzo were not warm. 19euro for my two dishes,so overpriced $32 aus.my daughter penna pasta was small at 19euro and sauce was salt less. STAFF were not friendly and it seem too much trouble for the French boy,rude,I was so annoyed and left hungry üòí

The food here is the best sushi I've ever eaten. It's really fresh. The setting is great by the side of the Douro with entertainers setting up nearby. Great for an evening in the sunshine - ask to be seated outside. Our only complaint is about the cost of water there. There were 8 of us and no one wanted alcohol so we ordered water all round. They opened 8 individual small glass bottles of water. We felt as we were there for a long time eating in the hot weather that we all needed more water so ordered 8 more. The bill was hefty overall but the water costs were about 50 euros which is ridiculous so be warned!

Do not be deceived by the name of the restaurant, you can get Portuguese food, Italian food AND sushi under one roof.  It is a lovely solution for my family as my kids just want to have pizza while my husband and I wanted to have Portuguese food.  We ended up trying their signature sushi too and it was delicious. It is located next to the river so the ambience is lovely. The staff are really helpful and friendly. If there is a rating of 6 I will give it.

They were very kind and helpful. They even gave us a blanket because it was very cold and we were sitting in the outdoor area. Sushi sticks were kinda difficult to hold so they got us a small device to hold them better.
As for the food, it was great, there was a great variety of food, great experience!!!!

This excellent sushi restaurant on the Ribiera serves interesting, creative dishes with the freshest fish.  We especially liked the Cais 35 special, as were the chicken and vegetable gyoza.  The food was so good we went back again next night.  Everything was delicious and the service was excellent.

Last Tuesday me and my family went to cais35 restaurant..my mother is vegetarian but there was nothing vegetarian in the menu..staff was very cooperative..they told chief about that. And chief make vegetarian sushi for my mom..they love it..all cuisines are very delicious .. decoration was superb..we enjoyed it a lot.. i recommend to everyone who want eat delicious and amazing sushi.. visit cais35 restaurant

We traveled here trying to determine which restaurants would be tourist traps and which would be good. We followed the trips advisor reviews and did not regret it. Beautiful fresh authentic Japanese Sushi with a crisp local rose wine right on the busy river bank in the center of Porto.

Cais35 made me realise that, in fact, going to a sushi restaurant is not just about satisfying the desire to eat a temaki or a few nigiris. 

Cais35, with its impeccable service, its kind and friendly staff, its absolutely fabulous and delicious dishes, served in a creative and appealing way, and, above all, his view and atmosphere that makes us feel good, with a smile on our face, forgetting everything that happens around us, simply enjoying and enjoying even more one of the greatest experiences you can have in the city of Porto, is undoubtedly my restaurant of choice, and I recommend it with all affection, to anyone who truly likes Japanese food, and an environment unmatched. Thank you Cais35 for explaining to me how sushi should really be enjoyed. I am not addicted to sushi... I am now addicted to Cais35!

I will surely come back...many, many times!

Excellent ramen and great service by a young Brazilian who speaks perfect English. Overall good atmosphere. We even got the secluded table that looks out over the water from the first floor. The ramen menu plus drink is good value for money. It‚Äôs a great little exception on the touristy places that serve similar stuff along the waterfront.

metadata.address: Rua de Oliveira Monteiro, 183, Porto 4050-442 Portugal

metadata.review_summary:
Postigo Do Carv√£o is celebrated for its charming riverside location, providing picturesque views without the crowds. The restaurant's atmosphere earns rave reviews, with many travelers appreciating its inviting ambiance and tasteful decor.

Guests often commend the generous portions and authentic flavors of the food, highlighting its great value. However, some reviewers advise booking ahead due to long wait times, and there are occasional notes on slow service during busy periods, despite the generally friendly and attentive staff.
metadata.address: Rua Da Fonte Taurina 24, Porto 4050-269 Portugal

reviews.review_text: Warm welcome .Seafood rice perfect, atmosphere superb.price unbelievable.staff cheerful and attentive without being over the top

This is a very casual place. The service was very good. The food was good and inexpensive. If you are looking for fancy place this is not it. I would go back to this restaurant again. Everytime we went this restaurant it always had people wanting to get in. Make a reservation if you plan on going.

Typical place with a warm welcome 
Excellent service for us with Tatiana smiling and available
Good food

St. John's Dinner 
Another great experience 
Very good service, sympathy from all staff.
Sardin peppers sangria Top
Always good feelings 
Thank you

Dinner, food was good- not our best meal.
Service was sporadic , we didn‚Äôt seem to have a server, no one was attentive but they were kind when they did come to the table

Just great. 
Traditional cuisine, impeccable service and very friendly.
The staff is very good advice especially regarding portions. 

Thank you so much!
Perfect restaurant. Fabulous menu, great service and fun staff. Jonathan made our evening. It is tucked away just behind the main front and is a little gem.

A great restaurant with a good price to quality balance. 

Tatiana was our waitress, and throughout the evening she was always smiling and very attentive. We found the food to be delicious, and the atmosphere very relaxing. We would return in a heartbeat!

Very welcoming staff. Good selection on the menu. Great food, well cooked and presentation. Loved that they brought samples of starters and desserts so you could see what was on offer. So good we went back a second time.

An excellent experience!  We ordered the seafood rice for two (it could feed at least 4).  It was filled with mussels, prawns and langoustines, and washed down with a large carafe of white wine. At a total of 50 euros, it was a very reasonable meal.  We were looked after by Jonathan, who was not only very professional and knowledgeable, he also had a great sense of humour and made our afternoon one to remember.  
We cannot wait to return!

The food was delicious, and the drinks were amazing too! This is the best restaurant in Porto! And a big thank you to our server Jonathan, who was so kind and professional! Thanks to him, we had such a wonderful evening üòÜü´∂

The seafood dish is super delicious, a lot of acres, light dishes, the soup of the dish is full of vegetables and fresh seafood delicious way, the portion is great, the restaurant atmosphere is good, the staff are very kind and friendly.
The price is reasonable, two servings of seafood steak 38 euros, highly recommended to visit the Bordeaux restaurant.
But it is recommended to make a reservation in advance!

Typical Portuguese restaurant in a very nice setting.
Excellent!!! Salt crust bar to recommend üòâ.
Very well received by Jonathan, a big thank you.

Great value restaurant with very tasty food. The service from Jonathan was fantastic - very informative about what was available, great sense of humour, and very pleasant - thank-you.

The ambience was very quaint and although busy, very relaxing.
The setting is very nice, the atmosphere friendly, the home super, and the dishes good and quality. Reserve absolutely. This place is rare in porto

metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

metadata.review_summary:
Cantina 32 is a popular choice for many travelers seeking a cozy and inviting dining experience. Guests have called out the friendly and attentive staff, although a few have felt rushed or faced language barriers. The generous portions and excellent food quality earn rave reviews, despite some noting inconsistency in taste.

Many diners appreciate the reasonable prices, yet some find service inconsistent. The atmosphere, often described as lovely, can sometimes be impacted by the staff, according to reviews.
metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

metadata.review_summary:
Bras√£o Antas is a popular dining spot for many travelers, offering generous portions of authentic Portuguese cuisine that earns rave reviews for both taste and presentation. The restaurant is praised for its affordable prices and cozy, bustling atmosphere, though some find the entrance area a bit crowded.

Service receives positive feedback for being friendly and attentive, despite occasional inexperience. However, reviewers warn that wait times can be long, even with reservations, so patience is advised.
metadata.address: Avenida de Fern√£o de Magalh√£es 1530, Porto 4350-157 Portugal
metadata.detailed_cuisines: Bar, Mediterranean, European, Portuguese, Beer restaurants

reviews.review_text:
As travellers from the UK, we were keen to try a few different Portuguese dishes during our stay in Porto and having spent a lot of time in the Ribeira / Gaia / Centro Historico districts, we thought it would be nice to visit a branch of Brasao that was in a more residential area near to our hotel. Brasao Antas was super easy to book, even with limited Portuguese and the restaurant is well located, only a 10 minute walk from Combatentes metro station (on the D line towards Hospital Sao Joao).

The staff at the restaurant are super friendly, have great English (helpfully for tourists like us, the menu is in both English and Portuguese) and are really attentive, which made the whole meal a real pleasure. The food is definitely the star of the show, though - we had Rissol (like an empanada) and rice chips to start, with Portuguese steak and a goat's cheese salad for the mains and all of the dishes were super fresh, delicious and came with extremely generous portions!

Well worth a visit if you're looking for a traditional, well priced Portuguese meal during your stay in Porto, especially if you happen to be staying in the more Northern part of the city or near to Estadio Dragao!

Being one of the best reviewed restaurants in the area, we booked a table at Brasao for after the FC Porto match. The staff were incredibly responsive to my email request and assisted in booking a table for the suitable time - we were grateful for this as there was a queue outside the door when we arrived. The bread and nibbles were the perfect way to start before we enjoyed the Traditional Francestira dish (with side of fries) and Grilled Pork ribs in wine sauce. All dishes were piping hot, very flavoursome and delicious - all come recommended. The bill (including 5 large beers) came to ‚Ç¨25 which was great value considering the quality of food and proximity to the stadium. If you are visiting for an FC Porto game, this is a great place to start/end your visit!

Great spot for an enjoyable evening meal! We‚Äôd booked a table for 7pm which is the time it opens for evening and we were expecting to be the only ones but it was bustling with customers which gave a great atmosphere! The food was fresh and delicious, plenty of choice and although more expensive than some places in Porto, it was 100% worth it!

We tried dinner at restaurant Bras√£o Antas on 28/01/2025. Some of the chain's restaurants open at 18:30 and this one would open at 19:00. 
We arrived for dinner at 18:43 and the manager of the establishment informed us that we could not even wait on site - day with very cold and rain. It was sharp and gave us no choice. 

Because of this, we know the Caf√© Velasques, a nice place with excellent service and good options of Francesinha.

This restaurant was absolutely amazing! The environment was warm and cozy, offering the perfect spot to chat as we enjoyed our dinner. All of the food was fresh, I would highly recommend the goat cheese salad and authentic Francesinha. With reasonable prices and friendly staff, this is a great spot for dinner if you are looking to get away from touristy downtown spots.

The restaurant was close to empty when we arrived at seven and completely jammed by 8 o‚Äôclock. We ordered a cocktail, a glass of wine and had the Franchesina and Pica-Pau as well as the orange and mustard salad and rice chips with a second glass of wine to follow.  The food was very good, and the bill totaled 60 Euro.   
There was way more food than the two of us could consume.  Service was friendly and very available.

Excellent atmosphere and wine list. We sat on the rooftop and it was quite pleasant. Staff was young and seemed a bit inexperienced (brought our bottle of wine opened it with some difficulty, then realized he forgot the glasses, for example), but attentive and efficient. Food was very good in presentation and flavor, we enjoyed an excellent goat cheese salad and mushroom truffle turnover. Portion size was ample.

The food is spectacular. The rib is the best I have ever eaten, the taste and point unbeatable. Very attentive and pleasant staff, others speak almost any language, very prepared and detailed. Samuel and Lucas advise very well and are very friendly. A place to recommend. The price is also very good, we paid 2 people 60‚Ç¨ and left over food.

The restaurant is very romantic, easily accessible by public transport. Menus were available in many different languages and the staff were always available. The dishes were delicious and we were amazed by the high quality of the desserts. Book well in advance, there is a long queue for dinner here. In my opinion, an inevitable half during a trip to Porto!!

Came to this restaurant after finding positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed!

The restaurant had a great vibe to it - really well laid out, so that it felt intimate, despite being quite large.  The decor is great and the whole place creates a really good first impression.

Our waiter was superb throughout the night and advised us on the local dishes on the menu.  Bread, olives and fresh capers were supplied as a matter of course (the capers locally are incredible) and the drinks were brought quickly.

We skipped starters and went straight for mains, choosing the local speciality of Pica Pau.  This is a kind of stew with slow-cooked beef, sausages and pickled vegetables in a beefy, tomato sauce, with melted cheese and served with fries and bread.  I guess it‚Äôs a bit like the Franchescina sandwich, but with more emphasis on the meat.

Whatever it is, it was absolutely delicious and we were so pleased we tried it.  It comes as a standard two person portion that you dig into and share, but you can order a half portion for one.

For dessert I had another Portuguese speciality called a Natas do Ceu, which is a crumble base with a very light milk mousse topped with a sable biscuit and mango sauce - do not pass go on this one - just order it!

My partner had the chocolate and hazelnut mousse which was served with all kinds of crumbly, soil-y type bits and was rich and smooth.

We had a bottle of house red and a beer to go with it and could have happily stayed there all night had we not been awake since 3am to get to Porto.

Absolutely superb experience - the food, service and ambience were fantastic and I‚Äôd throughly recommend a trip.

We made a reservation in advance and went for lunch, we ordered meat croquettes, truffle risole, rice chips with spicy mayonnaise, their legendary and delicious fried onion, and the main loin with Port sauce, foie and figs. All delicious ü§§
For dessert, the lemon tart, made with homemade meringue, is wonderful.
Excellent value for money, the place is beautiful and Claudio's attention, attentive at all times, added even more to our visit.
Thank you Claudio for your sympathy and affection.

On our next visit we will return to make reservations and eat on the terrace above

Our experience at this restaurant started much earlier because we didn't have a table for 5 at Brasao dos Estados Unidos, having been transferred later to Antas (which is why I recommend booking in advance). However, we couldn't be more satisfied with our choice, service and above all with the food, in which the Portuguese steak stood out, which was very tender, accompanied by a tasty sauce flavored with herbs, in my opinion the best ever. I ate! We couldn't help but mention the francesinhas which were also exceptional (note that it has a little hint of cuminhos for the weirdest) but also the quality pica-pau which is also based on the francesinha sauce. Regarding dessert, we ordered the delicious brownie, which is at least the equivalent of 2 desserts due to the portion size. But what we really liked most was Samuel's personalized service, which made the experience even more incredible. In short 10/10

We had dinner at Bras√£o Antas on June 20, 2024 and we really liked the restaurant. We were very well attended to by H√©rcules, who gave us a comprehensive explanation of the menu and the establishment's typical dishes.

We chose the Francesinha Bras√£o, which is a traditional dish and was very tasty. We had the lemon tart and the cream of heaven for dessert, which maintained the excellent level of the dinner.

I also cannot fail to mention the promptness and cordiality of the attendant Julia, who made our reservation over the phone and welcomed us when we arrived at the restaurant.

It was our first trip to Porto and we decided to try our first famous Francesinha in this restaurant and we couldn't choose better. The staff was incredibly friendly, especially the guy who served us who was attentive to us at all times, offering us even more sauce when it ran out. If we pass through the area again I will not hesitate to return. 100% recommendable.

What can we say about a restaurant that welcomes us in an absolutely memorable way, from the friendliness to the readiness to please the customer.
The entire staff was impeccable in serving and advising what to choose to taste.
In√™s and Daniel were unsurpassable, spectacular, friendly, attentive to the hygiene of everything surrounding a meal.

We chose the spicy patty, the truffle and mushroom patty, the meat croquette and the shrimp croquette, the latter was the most surprising, it was our favorite, although all the starters were very good.
For the main course we chose the old-fashioned francesinha and it was divine, one of the best francesinhas I've ever eaten and for dessert the lemon meringada tart, all with a balance of someone who knows what they're doing in a kitchen.
A restaurant that I rate 10/10... I will go back, without the slightest doubt.
What quality...
One word for everyone: Thank you.

metadata.review_summary:
C√∫mplice Steakhouse and Bar is a popular choice for many travelers seeking a cozy and inviting atmosphere, highlighted by its trendy and modern decor. The restaurant's exceptional culinary experiences, especially its steaks, truffle mash, and pear dessert, earn rave reviews, though some find it a bit pricey.

Reservations are often essential due to its busy nature, but short waits are typically rewarded with complimentary drinks. Reviewers frequently praise the attentive and welcoming service that enhances the dining experience.
metadata.address: Rua de Passos Manuel 225 R/c, Porto 4000-385 Portugal

metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

metadata.address: Rua De Costa E Almeida 255, Porto 4200-236 Portugal
metadata.special_diets: Vegetarian friendly, Vegan options, Gluten free options

metadata.review_summary:
Muro Do Bacalhau is celebrated by many travelers for its innovative take on traditional Portuguese cuisine, with flavorful, shareable dishes. The restaurant's scenic location along the Douro River enhances the dining experience for most guests, though some mention communication issues regarding outdoor seating. While service is generally friendly, experiences can vary.

Despite occasional long waits without reservations, many find the atmosphere modern and cozy. Travelers often praise the reasonable prices, although portion sizes and service consistency are occasionally noted.
metadata.detailed_cuisines: Portuguese, Seafood, Wine Bar, European, Mediterranean
metadata.special_diets: Vegan options, Vegetarian friendly, Gluten free options

metadata.address: Rua Julio Dinis 858 Boavista, Porto 4050-322 Portugal
metadata.meal_types: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Brunch, Late Night, Drinks

metadata.review_summary:
Yuko restaurant is popular among many travelers for its rustic and welcoming atmosphere, adorned with beautiful decor reminiscent of Northern Portugal. Guests often highlight the flavorful and slightly spicy sauce, though opinions on the quality of the steak and fries vary.

While some find the prices reasonable, others feel they don‚Äôt match the food quality. Service experiences are mixed; some guests praise the friendly and efficient staff, whereas others report encountering delays and unresponsiveness.
metadata.address: Rua de Costa Cabral 2331, Porto 4200-232 Portugal

reviews.review_text:
A wonderful experience! It is good, it is worked with love and precision, everything is prepared immediately, with fresh products. 
And if you eat at the counter, facing the kitchen, you will see as a bonus the show of the cooks, who, in a perfect ballet, prepare what you will taste a few moments later!
We waited a little while because success is at hand, but this wait was rewarded by a wonderful moment! Thank you! Jean Paul and Nathalie d‚ÄôAndernos .

A simple, unpretentious place, with a lovely staff, a menu without great flourishes but with a raw material and good dishes not, delicious, where the taste is above all, and all this at a much more than reasonable price. When we saw an employee arrive with the boxes of lettuce and onions, we already knew that the product would be natural, without resorting to prewashed and cut bags. Highly recommended.

We have been in Portugal for 10 days now, it is BY FAR the place where we have eaten the best with my partner. The list of positive points will be long knowing that in our eyes there are no negative points:

- IRREPROACHABLE service and very pleasant and attentive waiters and waitresses.
- very clean indoor restaurant
- now regarding the chef and his team, such a choice of homemade riss√≥is (as well as EVERYTHING ELSE) is, in my eyes, a titanic job. I can‚Äôt even imagine the workload upstream of the service.
He is also extremely attentive to his customers, always available to provide advice or explanations on the preparation of his dishes.
My partner had forgotten to order a side dish, he had a lot of orders but absolutely did not hesitate to make her salad right away so that she could eat her side dish at the same time as me.
I wish all the success that this type of establishment deserves.

It is a special and differential place. The service is excellent and the treatment is very professional and familiar. Being a small place, you have the opportunity to meet the restaurant team and you realize that apart from the high culinary level, there are great people behind the service. 100% recommended and at a very good price.

The restaurant is located in a small neighborhood, like a small Trastevere, full of these "bistros" for a quick meal.
It also has an outdoor space for dining.
The service was fast and kind.
"Rissois" are stuffed turnovers, baked or fried.
You can choose the contents and we tried 4: with meat, vegetarian and with prawns.
Detailed, but not exciting.
A nice salad of lettuce and tomatoes.
Two beers.
Spent for two ‚Ç¨23.20

Great experience.
Warm welcome and service from Mariza. 
Really enjoyed the rissois - Shiitake mushroom, veal.
They use free-range chicken and serve organic salad, which was excellent.
Excellent service - Sidney was very helpful, went above and beyond and made a perfect Aperol spritz!
Thankyou!

We stumbled upon this lovely place by chance, and sometimes chance does things well!

After a few minutes of waiting, the team seated us at the counter ‚Äì at first glance, not ideal for chatting (group of 5 girls ;-) ), but we quickly changed our minds. First, the setting: a magnificent zinc counter overlooking the kitchens, all within a small cosy restaurant with a pleasant atmosphere. Then, the team: very friendly, attentive, and offering good advice! In short, a very enjoyable experience, and we were even able to chat with the french chef after the rush, we loved it !

And finally, we were able to discover the chef's rissois as well as Portuguese dishes, made with fresh, high-quality products, transformed by the talented chef who offers simple, local cuisine, prepared with brilliance and a lot of heart.

Huge shout-out for the salada da horta and the chili üòâ A thousand thanks for the welcome and the service, and congratulations to the team.

We went there twice in 3 days (including 1 takeaway)‚Ä¶ a good average üòâ

On my first ever visit to Porto, I was looking for a place with tapas and light fare. I stumbled on Officina Riss√≥is quite by accident, and one look at the menu sold me. A riss√≥l is a breaded Portuguese patty stuffed with meat, seafood, or vegetables, very much like an empanada. These riss√≥is are baked not fried, so they don‚Äôt feel heavy. I had a prawn riss√≥l and a chouri√ßo and queijo riss√≥l along with a bowl of divine tomato rice and a glass of Douro red wine. For dessert I had a rich berry panna cotta topped with meringues, and a glass of Nierpoort ruby port. Service was friendly and excellent, and, well, being able to sit outside on a February evening when you‚Äôre visiting from Ireland is just magical.

A must during a stay in Porto. The restaurants that offer Riss√≥is are numerous, you might as well choose the best! A French boss, a Canadian chef and a multilingual team, guaranteed efficiency. The welcome is very warm, the service impeccable and, like other customers, we were lucky to be seated at the counter, facing the team in the kitchen. The dishes are beautiful, good and homemade. Excellent value for money, thank you all for an excellent evening!

Dinner for two in this small restaurant unpretentious but delicious. No reservation: arrive early if you do not want to wait. The rissois are very good and if you settle in front of the kitchen you will see the chef in action. 33‚Ç¨ for two, desserts and drinks included. Languages spoken: Portuguese English Spanish French

There were no tables outside so we sat inside overlooking the chef working in the kitchen. This ended up being fortunate as we were able to chat with him about the food. We had the truffle, chicken and calzone rissois (two each as recommended) plus the tomato rice and a mixed salad to share, with a glass of red. The food was so delicious  and the salad was full of interesting vegetables  (the best we have had in Portugal). We  finished with a dark chocolate mousse and a rice pudding and a glass of port which felt decadent and treaty. The waiting staff were lovely. The chef was friendly and chatty but unobtrusive. What a great dining experience! Walked out happy and feeling full but not as if we had had a heavy meal. Also very reasonably priced.  Highly recommend.

I don‚Äôt normally do restaurant reviews, but this establishment is the exception. A very small eatery with more dining on the footpath than actually within the restaurant itself. The food quality is excellent and very wholesome. Prices are reasonable and the wine list is good. What makes this place stand out is the service, which is attentive and very timely. We went three times in a row during our stay in Porto and was well looked after each time. The fact it is very popular is testament to its quality. I would happily dine their  again.

If you‚Äôre a fan of traditional cuisine, you absolutely have to try the rissois! These delightful ‚Äúcroquettes‚Äù or ‚Äúmeat pies‚Äù are simply amazing. My personal favorite? The mushroom filling‚Äîit‚Äôs bursting with flavor! Trust me, you won‚Äôt want to miss out on these culinary gems!

We had a wonderful experience at Oficina Dos Rissois. So good, in fact we visited 5x during our 30 day stay in Porto. There is one gluten free option-French fries (best I found in Porto) - but the chef/owner is eager to add more gluten free items. We sat at the end of the counter and watched the chef do his thing while he prepared the food. It was great fun talking with him! My wife loved the food. The service was excellent! They are expanding into the building door so there will be table seating soon. Recommended!

Just fabulous tomato rice.. 
Very good rice, are made in the oven, very soft and tasty pasta and incredible filling, especially liked the calf and red caril. Very good desserts also...
And best of all, 10/10 service, attentive and concerned staff.
It is definitely an experience to repeat.

metadata.review_summary:
Brasaria Carvalhido is a popular dining spot, celebrated by many travelers for its flavorful, tender meats and generous portions that offer excellent value for money. Guests have called out the interactive hot stone cooking as a standout feature. The warm and inviting atmosphere enhances the dining experience, according to reviews.

Service is often praised for being attentive and knowledgeable, despite occasional slower moments. Reviewers warn that advance reservations are recommended due to the restaurant's busy wait times.

metadata.detailed_cuisines: Bar, European, Portuguese, Wine Bar, Dining bars

metadata.review_summary:
Brunchit in Porto is popular among travelers for its cozy and stylish atmosphere, with impressive design and friendly service. Many guests appreciate the delicious and artistically presented dishes, though a few find the flavors a bit overwhelming.

While the exceptional food and attentive service earn praise, some guests consider the prices on the higher side. However, the staff's dedication to ensuring a pleasant dining experience is frequently highlighted by visitors.

reviews.review_text: Having visited Brunchit during our city break to Madrid, their Porto cafe was firmly on our list. We visited on a rainy morning shortly after they opened so had the pick of the seating, but by the time we left there was a queue outside - that tells you how good the food is. We enjoyed the Vegan and Salty pancakes, Sexy Omelette, and Yoghurt bowl - alongside the oat milk flat whites and a specially made hot chocolate. The cafe has a great vibe as you can see into the kitchen and hear the coffee grinder - this isn‚Äôt your typical cafe chain!

This was a great start to our day.  The space is bright and open and the staff very friendly.  I‚Äôm a bit of a chai snob, but the one I had here was SO good - one of the best I‚Äôve had! The food was presented beautifully, and was delicious.  We both got the Avocado Feast with egg - one with poached egg, one with scrambled.  I was expecting toasted bread, which I prefer, so I wasn‚Äôt a big a fan of the texture the crushed tomato created on that slice of bread. The avocado covered slice I had fewer issues with, and the overall flavours were excellent. I particularly liked the pop of flavour the pomegranate arils provided.  Both types of eggs were nicely cooked, but if you want an egg on each slice, ensure you ask for 2 poached eggs.  The scrambled eggs came as a side, and the portion appeared to be larger.  Overall, we both really enjoyed our meal, and it filled us plenty for 4 hours of walking the city.  The menu had lots of options, and it appears that vegetarians would have plenty to choose from. Would recommend.

This spot boasts an incredible location and outstanding design. 
The restaurant is in a prime location, just a short walk from the metro and a variety of commercial and surrounded by fantastic atractions.
We have visit the place to have lunch, the quality of the food was exceptional and the waiters went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed, responding quickly to any questions.  If you¬¥re visiting Porto, this should be your top choice for having a high quality brunch. Highly recommended!

We visited Brunchit twice on our short trip to Porto, as we were so impressed on our first visit. The location is central, but tucked away so it feels secluded! It was relatively quiet on both days that we went (Tuesday and Thursday) there was plenty of space and it wasn‚Äôt busy like some of the other brunch spots we had found on Instagram. A lovely quiet outside spot where you can sit and enjoy some peace! The decor and vibe is beautiful. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. We had the chocolate pancakes, the salty pancakes and the brioche. They were all delicious and the presentation was excellent!

Super Recommend ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è.
Beautiful place, cozy, look super clean and fresh.. Divinely crafted dishes with presentation that equals true works of art.. the harmony between colors and flavour is an explosion that will undoubtedly remain in your memory. I loved it and it is a place to return whenever you visit Porto üòçüòçüòç.. the best Dutch sauce I have eaten so far... it will be hard to find eggs benedit and heated as good as.. üëèüèΩüëèüèΩüëèüèΩ Worth the price and the experience. üôèüèΩ‚ù§Ô∏èüòä

I really enjoyed eating here. The atmosphere is cozy, the service is great and the dishes are very hearty. We came with friends for brunch and we were not disappointed. Awards are higher than elsewhere (15-20‚Ç¨/pers) but the Award is worth the meal.

Nice and friendly atmosphere. However, very expensive for what is and is not good at all. Coffee for 4‚Ç¨ and dishes between 15-17‚Ç¨. Most dishes have the same sauce and taste like it kills the taste of toast or eggs. 
I would recommend it for coffee but for breakfast or brunch or a joke. Total tourist. 
We were a group of 6 friends and we all agreed in the opinion, there are better options in Porto!

An excellent spot for brunch. I had the eggcellent with a caramel frappe and my friend had the eggs porn with an iced latte. Both were excellent and I would strongly recommend both. Service by all members of staff, particularly Abnner who was very warm and welcoming, was exceptional. A must visit for a brunch in Porto!

Brunch at Brunchit was an absolute treat! The food was not only extremely delicious, but also very loving and beautifully arranged. You immediately notice that quality and presentation are important here. The service was also extremely friendly and made us feel welcome. A perfect start to the day.

Absolutely delicious. Kids had pancakes with fruit and Nutella. I had smashed avocado and tomatoes on sourdough with a poached egg. Possibly the best breakfast I‚Äôve ever had in my life. Definitely the best I‚Äôve had in Porto so far. A bit pricey (‚Ç¨13 euro for brunch) but very filling. Coffee was delicious.

We visited the local for breakfast on weekends. It was well filled but it was no problem to get a place for three people. The selection is abundant, contains savoury and sweet. The dishes are all very delicious and always nicely prepared for the eye. Perfect for a good start to the day!

Very spacious, modern, welcoming. Relaxed environment, no annoying noises. It has an interesting letter and good prices. The staff is attentive and friendly, served quickly (without melting). I ate a delicious hamburger. I'll come back whenever possible!

Choice of sweet and salty, meat, vegetarian or even vegan. 
Very nicely arranged and corresponds to the pictures on the menu.
Value for money was fully fine. The service was very friendly.
I would recommend a visit.

Very tasty food, well prepared and in generous doses. 
Innovative combination of flavors and very well decorated dishes. Very nice environment, well decorated. Efficient service, professional and with a lot of sympathy.
Stayed on my list of Porto's best brunchs.

If you like brunch, go to Brunch IT Porto!
Everything is excellent!!! The cuisine, the welcome, the service, the advice and the beautiful place... Really TOP!
We feasted!!!
Our only regret? To have gone on the last day of our stay , otherwise we will have returned it is obvious!!
When do you settle in France, in Montpellier? It would be a sure success!!!
Ps: the pancakes are to fall on the floor so good they are!!!
